source:
# Cleaning spd_incident dataset

input: spd_incident.csv

output: clean_spd_incident.csv

Combined incident data from 2017-2021 that were in separate EXCEL files into one EXCEL file and then named this file "spd_incident." Then, converted this EXCEL file to .csv to work with in Jupityr. 

Checked:

How many missing values in each column

What type is each column

Changes made:

Condensed headers and made lowercase

Made time column more reader-friendly (not military time and with AM/PM specifications)

Made bias columns entries all lower case because some were in all caps while others were camel case

0 17-29506 1/31/2017 900 5700 BLOCK OF BROADWAY 6B Anti-Black

3 17-1803960 2/14/2017 1757 7400 BLOCK OF AMHERST ST 5A Anti-Black
4 17-1802867 2/25/2017 2237 1400 BLOCK OF U ST 3A Anti-Asian/Pacific Islander

source:
import pandas as pd
spd_incident = pd.read_csv("spd_incident.csv")

#Renaming column names
spd_incident.rename(columns = {'Case Number':'case', 'Report Date':'date', 'Incident Time':'time',
                              'Location':'location', 'Beat':'beat', 'Bias Motivation': 'bias'}, inplace = True)

spd_incident.head()

source:
#Making bias entries all lower case because some all caps and some camel case case
spd_incident["bias"] = spd_incident["bias"].str.lower()
spd_incident

source:
#Exporting clean_spd_incident df as csv
clean_spd_incident = spd_incident
clean_spd_incident.to_csv("clean_spd_incident.csv")
